EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



All employees of International Cushioning Corporation are provided the following policy statement:



It is the policy of International Cushioning Corporation to comply with all Environmental, Health and Safety regulations and requirements.  



Upon identifying a circumstance which could lead to a violation of a regulation or requirement established to protect human health, safety, and/or the environment, the person (or persons) identifying the circumstance shall take immediate corrective action, if such action is reasonably within their authority and ability to perform.  Should immediate correction not be performed, the person (or persons) identifying the circumstance shall immediately inform their supervisor, so that appropriate corrective actions can be taken.



Failure to comply with this policy may result in termination of employment.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled



International Cushioning Corporation manufactures expandable polystyrene resin.  Iso-pentane is used to manufacture the resin.



The maximum amount of iso-pentane onsite is 22,000 pounds.



General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



International Cushioning Corporation has developed and implemented a Process Safety Management Program and Risk Management Plan.  International Cushioning Corporation performs periodic Process Hazards Analyses and routine safety inspections.  The purpose of the program, plan, analyses and inspections are to ensure the safe operation and maintenance of the butane tank and the associated processes.



Five Year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of iso-butane since the facility began operations in 1993.



Emergency Response Program



International Cushioning Corporation maintains an Emergency Action / Emergency Response Plan.  The primary purpose of this plan is to ensure employee safety i

n the event of an emergency.  In the event of an accidental release, International Cushioning Corporation has and continues to work with the City of Lincolnton Fire Department to ensure public safety.  A copy of the Emergency Response Program and Risk Management Plan has been provided to the City of Lincolnton Fire Department.  The City of Lincolnton Fire Department also performs periodic inspections of the pentane tank to supplement International Cushioning Corporation's routine inspections.  In the event of an accidental release, the City of Lincolnton Fire Department will act as the primary emergency response agency.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety



No specific changes are planned to the regulated process.  International Cushioning Corporation plans to perform or cooperatively participate in the following safety reviews:



* Self performed routine inspections of the butane tank,

* Self performed periodic Process Hazards Analyses,

* Self performed periodic Process Safety Management Program audits, 

* Self performed periodic Risk Management Plan reviews,

* Insurance carrier inspections,

* City of Lincolnton Fire Department inspections,

* Occupational Health and Safety Administration Consultative Services inspections, and

* North Carolina, Division of Air Quality inspections.



In the event changes are identified through these inspections and/or safety reviews that would improve safety, International Cushioning Corporation plans to implement such changes.
